intro: Trigonotis formosana var. elevatovenosa, commonly known as the elevated-veined trigonotis, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The leaves are typically opposite and have a slightly hairy texture. This variant is distinguished by its elevated venation pattern, which sets it apart from other varieties of Trigonotis. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions of Taiwan.
